s.label: Element pattern fitting settings
s.desc: These settings are used when running the 'oskar_fit_element_data' application binary to fit splines to numerically-defined element pattern data.

s.label: Input CST file
s.desc: Pathname to a file containing an ASCII data table of the directional element pattern response, as exported by the CST software package in (theta, phi) coordinates. See the Telescope Model documentation for a description of the required columns.

s.label: Input scalar file
s.desc: Pathname to a file containing an ASCII data table of the scalar directional element pattern response. See the Telescope Model documentation for a description of the required columns.

s.label: Frequency [Hz]
s.desc: Observing frequency at which numerical element pattern data is applicable, in Hz.

s.label: Polarisation type
s.desc: Specify whether the input data is to be used for the X or Y dipole, or both. (This is ignored for scalar data.)

s.label: Element type index
s.desc: The type index of the element. Leave this at zero if there is only one type of element per station.

s.label: Ignore data at poles
s.desc: If true, then numerical element pattern data points at theta = 0 and theta = 180 degrees are ignored.

s.label: Ignore data below horizon
s.desc: If true, then numerical element pattern data points at theta > 90 degrees are ignored.

s.label: Average fractional error
s.desc: The target average fractional error between the fitted surface and the numerical element pattern input data. Choose this value carefully. A value that is too small may introduce fitting artifacts, or may cause the fitting procedure to fail. A value that is too large will cause detail to be lost in the fitted surface.

s.label: Average fractional error factor increase
s.desc: If the fitting procedure fails, this value gives the factor by which to increase the allowed average fractional error between the fitted surface and the numerical element pattern input data, before trying again. Must be > 1.0.

s.label: Telescope or station directory
s.desc: Path to the telescope or station directory in which to save the fitted coefficients.
